article.headline: W. Carolina 83, Elon 81
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. -- Brandon Giles scored 25 points and Western Carolina held off Elon in an 83-81 win on Saturday night. Mike Williams finished with 15 points for the Catamounts (14-3, 4-1 Southern Conference), who have won two in a row. Harouna Mutombo had 11 points, and Kendall Russell and Richie Gordon each had 10. Western Carolina took a 62-53 lead on Williams' layup with 11:10 left in the second half. The Phoenix (3-14, 1-5) attempted a rally, cutting the Catamounts' lead down to one point with 3:08 left on a 3-pointer by Chris Long, who finished with 15 points. But Elon would never pull ahead of Western Carolina, as the Catamounts took an 82-78 lead on Giles' three-point play. Giles went 8-for-12 from the floor and 4-for-7 from beyond the arc. Drew Spradlin led Elon with 22 points, while T.J. Douglas hit seven 3-pointers to score 21.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
